item.title: Add image to hugo site
item.description: In Hugo, you can add images to your page in several ways depending on where your images are stored. Here are the main methods: 1. Using Page Bundles (Recommended) If you’re using page bundles, place the image inside the same folder as your markdown file. Steps: Place the image inside the same directory as the markdown file: content/posts/my-post/ ├── index.md ├── my-image.jpg In index.md, reference the image using: ![Alt text](my-image.jpg) or !
